results.title: Riches of the Earth. Rev. ed.
results.creator_credit: Barry Helmer, Sidney Goldsmith and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Colourful animation illustrates how Canada’s underground resources took shape through geological ages, and how theses riches of the earth have become our raw materials. We see the formation, by fire, water, wind and ice, of the earth’s crust, with its wealth of minerals, coal, arable land and water.

results.title: Ridicule
results.creator_credit: Patrice Leconte, Michele Arnould, PolyGram, Sofica Investimage 4 and Canal+
results.brief_description: Set in the flamboyant court of Louis XVI, this is a sharp, satirical depiction of the excesses of court life. A life where men can be driven to suicide by the one thing that must be avoided at all costs: being the object of ridicule. Gregoire Ponceludon de Malavoy (Charles Berling), descendant of an old provincial family which has recently fallen on harsh times, approaches the court to appeal for funding for a draining project to save his province. Gregoire is unschooled in the practice of coiffing, face powder, false modesty and acerbic remarks, however he quickly wizens up to court protocol when he is befriended by the Marquis de Bellegarde (Jean Rochefort), an old doctor familiar in the ways of the court. The Marquis believes that Gregoire has the required amount of wit to infiltrate the royal court and make a successful appeal, now all Gregoire has to do is steer clear of humiliation and love as he prepares for an audience with the king. Cast includes Fanny Ardant, Charles Berling, Bernard Giraudeau, Judith Godreche and Jean Rochefort. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: From Riverbank to Dodge City
results.creator_credit: Ceciline Biles, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Moving from the riverbank to ‘Dodge City’ was like moving to another century. Regardless of the dramatic changes, some things stay the same.

results.title: Richard St Barbe Baker: man of the trees
results.creator_credit: Leon Narbey, John Maynard and Leon Narbey Productions
results.brief_description: Richard St. Barbe Baker, a 92 year old conservationist known as the “Man of the Trees” leads the campaign to reclaim the world’s deserts and to prevent virgin forests from destruction. Includes footage from his 1952 Sahara crossing and ecological survey and other archival material that sketches his early life and his involvement with conservation in several countries.

results.title: Ride straight Kate
results.creator_credit: Tony Mahood, Lynda House and Film Victoria
results.brief_description: Jason collides with a car while out riding his bicycle and is admitted to hospital. His friends decide to visit him and during their ride to and from the hospital they are confronted with several situations where accidents could occur because of their own or others’ carelessness. This program examines, in an interesting manner, safe cycling practices.

results.title: Richard III [study extract]
results.brief_description: This extract shows the opening sequence of “Richard III”, the third of Olivier’s Shakespearian interpretations on film. It remains almost literally as Shakespeare wrote it. Instead of a coldly evil villain as in the stage version, Richard becomes a cocky, artful and almost likeable villain. The opening scene of “Edward VI”, Part 3, is actually the last scene of “Henry VI”, Part 3, and it serves admirably to convey the different levels of court intrigues and tensions and to heighten the effect of Richard’s soliloquy: “Now is the winter of our discontent…” The cast includes Laurence Olivier as Richard and Cedric Hardwicke as Edward IV. Music by William Walton.

results.title: Richard III
results.creator_credit: Laurence Olivier and London Film Productions
results.brief_description: Richard III is the story of one man’s unbridled lust for the crown. Richard’s ambition leaves all who oppose him dead, pawns in his ruthless bid for the throne. This is a majestic film in every sense of the word, and one of the greatest films ever produced in England. Directed by, and starring, Laurence Olivier with Ralph Richardson, Claire Bloom and John Gielgud.

Directed by, and starring, Laurence Olivier with Ralph Richardson, Claire Bloom and John Gielgud.

results.title: Rhonda’s story : spoken by Ada Peterson
results.creator_credit: Ada Peterson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Speaking for her sister, Rhonda, Ada Peterson gives us some insight into the anguish and confusion of being a member of the ‘Stolen Generation’. While Rhonda understands too well the psychological trauma experienced by the parents whose children were taken, she doesn’t understand why they refuse to talk about it today.
